page.title: 02HOUSING
page.content: Low Hesket is a small village in which the old houses are mostly cottages and semi-detached. They are built out of local stone which is sandstone. As most of the villagers have lived there nearly all of their lives, it is a close knit community and many of the occupants are middle aged. The main way of heating the houses is by coal or solid fuel as the average age of the houses is 182 years. The buildings tend to be owned rather than rented and the prices range from Â£20,000 to Â£150,000 each. Even though they are old all of the houses have a telephone and hot and cold water. Each person we asked was satisfied with their house and said the reason they like living there was because Carlisle and the lakes are very convenient and they prefer living in a rural area rather than a town.
